data.scheme_name: Haryana AatmaNirbhar Textile Policy 2022-25 - Skill Training - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides subsidy of 50% of the total project cost, with limits of Rs.1000 lakhs for setting up of common facility for training in textile and apparel sectors.
data.eligibility: All existing units form group of MSMEs and function as textile enterprises are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Units must have Udhyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udyam Memorandum (HUM).
  2. Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) must be formed for setting up and running the proposed common facility training center (CFTC).
  3. The SPV should be a Section 8 Company (non-profit) under the Companies Act, 2013.
  4. No SPV formation is required for other eligible implementing agencies (IAs).
  5. The Common facility training centre should be housed in land/building owned by the IA or leased.
  6. If leased, the lease must be registered for a minimum of 10 years.
  7. The total share of beneficiaries should be at least 50% of the total project cost in the case of an SPV.
  8. A single member in the SPV can hold a maximum of 25% equity capital (or equivalent contribution).
  9. The SPV should consist of textile MSMEs as serving members, with no ceiling on the maximum number of members.
data.beneficiaries: All existing units form group of MSMEs and function as textile enterprises are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Units must have Udhyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udyam Memorandum (HUM).
  2. Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) must be formed for setting up and running the proposed common facility training center (CFTC).
  3. The SPV should be a Section 8 Company (non-profit) under the Companies Act, 2013.
  4. No SPV formation is required for other eligible implementing agencies (IAs).
  5. The Common facility training centre should be housed in land/building owned by the IA or leased.
  6. If leased, the lease must be registered for a minimum of 10 years.
  7. The total share of beneficiaries should be at least 50% of the total project cost in the case of an SPV.
  8. A single member in the SPV can hold a maximum of 25% equity capital (or equivalent contribution).
  9. The SPV should consist of textile MSMEs as serving members, with no ceiling on the maximum number of members.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.context: Textile sector has significant importance for the state’s economy as this is the largest employer within the MSME sector in the state after agriculture.
data.objective: To increase the employability through imparting of wide range of skill sets in various segments of textile sectors.
data.description:
Scheme provides skill training subsidy for setting up of Common facility for training in textile and apparel sectors:

  1. B category: 50% of the total project cost, upto Rs 200 lakhs
  2. C category: 50% of the total project cost, upto Rs 500 lakhs
  3. D category: 50% of the total project cost, upto Rs 1000 lakhs
data.how_to_apply:
The beneficiaries of the common facility training centre shall submit the application (Annexure – I) along with Detailed Project Report (DPR) and Background Verification form (Annexure – II) online on the portal.
Annexure-I: https://cdnbbsr.s3waas.gov.in/s3f48c04ffab49ff0e5d1176244fdfb65c/uploads/2023/07/2023070689.pdf
Annexure-II: https://cdnbbsr.s3waas.gov.in/s3f48c04ffab49ff0e5d1176244fdfb65c/uploads/2023/07/2023070689.pdf
data.funding_facilitator: Director General, Directorate of MSME of Haryana
data.funding_mechanism:
The applicant will get the grant in 2 installment:

  1. First installment : 50% of the approved grant will be released after the SPV incurs 50% of its contribution/equity on eligible project costs.
  2. Second installment : Remaining 50% will be released once the SPV has fully utilized the first installment and made 100% of its contribution.
data.checklist_info_a:
Application in the prescribed format (Annexure – 1).
Detailed project report (Annexure-9).
Final Sanction letter of term loan.
Appraisal report from Bank/Financial Institution.
Certificate of incorporation/ registration of the organization, Memorandum and Articles of Association and Bye laws of the society (If applicable)/partnership deed etc.
Annual reports and Audited Statement of Accounts of last 3 years.
Blueprint/ Building Plan.
Land title documents for at least 15 years in case of MSME and Large units and at least 20 years in case of Anchor Units.
Change in Land Use (CLU)/ NOC permission for the project for said land from Competent Authority.
CA certificate regarding the proposed project cost and means of finance.
Chartered Engineer Certificate (Civil)
Chartered Engineer Certificate (Mechanical).
A declaration to the effect: “that the organization has not obtained/applied or will not obtain any grant/subsidy from any Ministry/Department of Central Govt./State GoI organization/agencies for the same purpose/ activity/same components”.
Latest Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM). Aditionally URC for MSMEs and Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM) for Large and Anchor Units.
Documents in support of net-worth of the promoter in case of Anchor units.
Document in support of women/SC led enterprises/ enterprises coming up in textile related cluster in respective PADMA block.
Quotations for plant & machinery and equipments. Certificate from Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) or Registered Valuer for second-hand machines.

For 1st Instalment: 
Duly notarized Surety Bond {Annexure 2}
Duty notarized Affidavit {Annexure-3}
Chartered Accountant Certificate (For 50% utilization) {Annexure 4}
Bank Certificate certifying that they have released 50% of term loan. {Annexure 5}
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Civil) {Annexure 6}
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) for Plant & Machinery {Annexure 7}. certificate from CE (Mechanical) or Registered Valuer for second-hand machines.
Documents mentioned in the approval letter.
Bank Statement and Term Loan Statement showing payment made to suppliers/vendors.
Copy of invoices/receipts from the suppliers/vendors.
Compliance of conditions imposed in the approval letter of the grant-in-aid, if any.
Physical Site inspection report by inspection committee under the chairmanship of Additional Director, MSME.

For 2nd Instalment: 
Chartered Accountant Certificate (For 50% utilization) {Annexure 4}
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Civil) {Annexure 6} 
Certificate of Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) {Annexure 7}. Certificate from Chartered Engineer (Mechanical) or Registered Valuer in case of second-hand machinery.
Utilization Certificate (CA-Certified) and countersigned by the promoter of the beneficiary company. {Annexure 8} 
Bank Certificate certifying that they have released 100% of term loan. {Annexure 5} 
Bank Statement and Term Loan Statement showing payment made to suppliers/vendors. 
Copy of invoices/receipts from the suppliers/vendors.
Compliance of conditions imposed in the approval letter of the grant-in-aid, if any.
Physical Site inspection report by inspection committee under the chairmanship of Additional Director, MSME.
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: Plot No. C-3, HSVP Complex, Sector 6, Panchkula – 134109
Phone: 0172-2580707
Email ID: info-msme@hry.gov.in
